titles.title: Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
To redesignate the Jimmy Carter National Historic Site as the "Jimmy Carter National Historical Park".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 116-643.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 528.

action.text: Mr. Gallego moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5472.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Natural Resources

term.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

bill.summary:
Jimmy Carter National Historical Park Redesignation Act
This bill redesignates the Jimmy Carter National Historic Site in Georgia as the Jimmy Carter National Historical Park.
